cities.aboutCity:
Montreal has long been a cornerstone of ELDOA in North America. As one of the two anchor cities for Soma Education Canada, the official Canadian ELDOA certification body, Montreal serves as a major training hub where new practitioners are trained and certified. The city's bilingual community has a natural connection to the method — ELDOA was created by French osteopath Dr. Guy VOYER, and much of the original methodology and instruction was developed in French.

The Francophone community in Quebec was among the first in North America to embrace ELDOA and myofascial stretching, with practitioners integrating the method into physiotherapy clinics, sports conditioning centers, and wellness studios across the city. From the Plateau to Westmount, Montrealers have access to practitioners who specialize in spinal decompression, fascial work, and postural correction.
cities.whyPopular:
Montreal's athletic culture and active lifestyle make it a natural fit for ELDOA. The city's long winters drive demand for indoor movement practices that address the postural strain of cold-weather living — think hunched shoulders, tight hip flexors from sitting, and lower back pain from icy sidewalks. ELDOA's targeted spinal decompression exercises offer relief without medication or surgery.

The city is also home to world-class athletes and sports organizations that have embraced fascial training and myofascial stretching as part of their performance and recovery protocols.

sportsConnections.note: Professional hockey places enormous strain on the spine and hips. NHL teams across Canada have increasingly adopted myofascial stretching and fascial chain work — techniques rooted in the same principles as ELDOA — for player recovery and injury prevention. The repetitive skating motion, body checking, and compressed postures on the bench make spinal decompression exercises highly relevant for hockey athletes.

Professional soccer athletes deal with chronic hip, groin, and lower back issues from the constant running, cutting, and kicking demands of the sport. Fascial training and targeted myofascial stretching have gained traction in MLS training rooms as players and trainers look for methods to address the deep fascial chains that connect the foot, hip, and spine.

Football players at every level are among the most likely to suffer spinal compression injuries. The CFL's Montreal Alouettes and teams across the league have access to sports medicine professionals who incorporate fascial release techniques similar to ELDOA for post-game recovery and long-term spinal health.

trainingHub.name: Soma Education Canada
trainingHub.description: Montreal is one of two Canadian cities (alongside Toronto) where Soma Education Canada offers ELDOA certification training. Practitioners from across Quebec and Eastern Canada travel to Montreal for Level 1-4 training courses.

faqs.question: Where can I find ELDOA classes in Montreal?
faqs.answer: Montreal has several trained ELDOA practitioners offering private sessions and group classes. Lisa-Marie Farley (Level 4, Institut SomaTraining director) leads instruction in the city, and practitioners like Alan Cohen (Alan Cohen Health) and Troy Perrin (Afterburn) offer ELDOA-integrated sessions. Check their websites for current schedules and booking.

faqs.question: Is ELDOA popular in Montreal?
faqs.answer: Yes — Montreal is one of Canada's most established ELDOA communities. As a bilingual city with deep ties to French culture, Montreal was among the first North American cities to adopt ELDOA, which was created by French osteopath Dr. Guy VOYER. The city is an official Soma Education Canada training hub.

faqs.question: How much do ELDOA sessions cost in Montreal?
faqs.answer: Private one-on-one ELDOA sessions in Montreal typically range from $80-150 CAD per hour. Group classes are usually $25-45 CAD per session. Many studios offer package deals and monthly memberships. Some practitioners also offer virtual sessions at reduced rates.

faqs.question: Do any Montreal sports teams use ELDOA or myofascial stretching?
faqs.answer: While specific team protocols are not publicly disclosed, myofascial stretching and fascial chain training — the same principles underlying ELDOA — are widely used in professional sports rehabilitation across Montreal. NHL, MLS, and CFL training staffs regularly incorporate spinal decompression and fascial release techniques for player recovery.

faqs.question: Can I get ELDOA help online if I'm in Montreal?
faqs.answer: Yes! If you can't find a convenient in-person option, several online practitioners serve the Montreal area. Popular options include Toronto ELDOA (Mon/Thu/Sun live Zoom sessions) and H3TV by Dan Hellman (subscription video library). You can also explore ELDOA METHOD from New Zealand for live Zoom group classes.

cities.aboutCity:
New York City's ELDOA community has grown rapidly as more New Yorkers discover the method's effectiveness for addressing the specific postural challenges of city living. From desk workers in Midtown suffering from chronic lower back pain to performers on Broadway dealing with repetitive strain, ELDOA's targeted spinal decompression exercises offer a precise, no-equipment approach to pain relief that fits the city's fast-paced lifestyle.

NYC is home to multiple Level 4 Certified Trainers and several advanced practitioners who bring diverse backgrounds in Pilates, movement science, and holistic wellness. Studios across Manhattan — from the Upper West Side to downtown — now offer ELDOA as a standalone modality or integrated into broader movement programs.
cities.whyPopular:
New York's unique lifestyle demands make ELDOA particularly relevant. Hours spent commuting on the subway, sitting at desks in high-rise offices, and navigating concrete sidewalks take a toll on the spine. ELDOA exercises specifically target the fascial chains that get compressed and shortened during these daily activities, offering relief in as little as one minute per position.

The city's wellness-forward culture and appetite for science-backed fitness methods have also fueled ELDOA's growth. As word spreads through Pilates studios, physical therapy clinics, and personal training circles, more New Yorkers are seeking out practitioners who can teach them these targeted decompression techniques.

sportsConnections.note: Professional basketball demands explosive movement, vertical jumping, and constant direction changes that compress the spine. NBA training staffs have increasingly adopted fascial training and myofascial stretching protocols to help players maintain spinal health throughout the grueling 82-game season. The principles of ELDOA — targeted decompression of specific spinal segments — align directly with what elite basketball players need for recovery.

Baseball's rotational demands place enormous asymmetric stress on the spine. Throwing, batting, and fielding all involve explosive spinal rotation that can lead to disc issues and fascial imbalances. MLB teams have been at the forefront of adopting fascial chain training and myofascial release techniques for both performance enhancement and injury prevention.

NFL athletes face some of the highest spinal compression forces in all of professional sports. Tackling, blocking, and absorbing hits compress vertebral segments repeatedly over a season. Fascial training and spinal decompression methods derived from the same principles as ELDOA are used in NFL training facilities to help players recover and maintain spinal health between games.

Hockey's skating posture, body checking, and board play create significant spinal compression and fascial strain. NHL training staffs across the league have embraced myofascial stretching and fascial chain work — techniques rooted in the same science as ELDOA — for player recovery and long-term joint health.

faqs.question: Is ELDOA popular in New York City?
faqs.answer: ELDOA is growing rapidly in NYC. Multiple Pilates studios and wellness centers now integrate ELDOA into their offerings, and word-of-mouth among fitness professionals has fueled steady growth.
